Package gov.tak.api.cot

Class CoordinatedTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.tak.api.cot.CoordinatedTime
  • public class CoordinatedTime
extends java.lang.Object
    Instances of this class provide support for a GPS time delta for shifting values from System.currentTimeMillis() accordingly when creating new CoordinatedTime instances.

    Methods are provided for parsing/formatting according to the CoT standard ISO 1601 format, but all those operations are forwarded to CotFormatting.

    Since:
    6.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  CoordinatedTime.SimpleDateFormatThread
      Allows for a Thread Safe usage of any SimpleDateFormat construct.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CoordinatedTime

        public CoordinatedTime()
        For creating new timestamps within the system, this method should be used directly.

        Create a CoT time that represents the current time:

        1. based on system time measured as the number of milliseconds since the epoch
        2. or if a GPS delta has been set, the system time corrected to GPS time
        note: GPS time is not used directly, a correction is used instead, due to the poor granularity of GPS time.

      • CoordinatedTime

        public CoordinatedTime​(CoordinatedTime source)
        Copy Constructor.

      • CoordinatedTime

        public CoordinatedTime​(long milliseconds)
        Create a CoT time in milliseconds since January 1st 1970 00:00:00 UTC.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - offset in milliseconds from Unix Epoch

      • CoordinatedTime

        public CoordinatedTime​(java.lang.String cotTime)
        Construct a CoordinatedTime from the CoT date/time string, using ISO 8601 format: 2009-09-15T21:00:00.00Z.
        Parameters:
        cotTime - CoT Time string to parse

    • Method Detail

      • setCoordinatedTimeMillis

        public static void setCoordinatedTimeMillis​(long gpsTime)
        Set the global offset between the current system time in milliseconds since the epoch and the GPS time milliseconds since the epoch.

        Setting the gps time to <= 0 indicates no GPS time exists and the coordinated time will be the local system time.

        Parameters:
        gpsTime - Relative GPS time, this value is subtracted from the current system time

      • isGPSTime

        public static boolean isGPSTime()
        Indicate if GPS time has been set.
        See Also:
        setCoordinatedTimeMillis(long)

      • getCoordinatedTimeOffset

        public static long getCoordinatedTimeOffset()
        If GPS time has been set, provide the offset from the GPS time and the local device time. If GPS has not been set, the offset will be 0.

        Note: If GPS time is behind the system time, the number will be negative.

      • currentDate

        public static java.util.Date currentDate()
        Obtains the current date:
        1. based on system time measured as the number of milliseconds since the epoch.
        2. or if a GPS delta has been set, the system time corrected to GPS time
        note: GPS time is not used directly, a correction is used instead, due to the poor granularity of GPS time.

      • currentTimeMillis

        public static long currentTimeMillis()
        Obtains the current time in millis since the EPOCH, adjusted for GPS drift if available.
        Returns:
        the time in milliseconds from EPOCH

      • millisecondDiff

        public long millisecondDiff​(CoordinatedTime other)
        The difference, in milliseconds, between this coordinated time and the given one. If the given time is "in the future" compared to this one, then the result will be > 0.
        Parameters:
        other - The coordinated time to compare
        Returns:
        Difference in milliseconds

      • addMilliseconds

        public CoordinatedTime addMilliseconds​(long milliseconds)
        Create a new CoT time that is a positive or negative number of milliseconds from this Cot time.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - number of milliseconds to add (may be negative)
        Returns:
        a new CoordinatedTime with the given number of milliseconds added

      • toCot

        public static java.lang.String toCot​(CoordinatedTime time)
        Produce a valid Cursor on Target formatted date string from a CoordinatedTime object.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the formatted string.

      • setLoggerDirectory

        public static void setLoggerDirectory​(java.io.File dir)
        Designate for refactoring. Set a reasonable log directory for bad_time, until this is refactored.

      • fromCot

        public static CoordinatedTime fromCot​(java.lang.String date)
                               throws java.text.ParseException
        Parse a CoT time String in the form: 2009-09-15T21:00:00.00Z without using simple date parser. Thread-safe

        Note: This will parse the CoT time string in the format 2009-09-15T21:00:00.00Z and will permissively allow for 2009-09-15T21:00:00.000Z and 2009-09-15T21:00:00.0Z which are not part of the spec.

        Parameters:
        date - A date from a CoT message.
        Returns:
        the coordinated time derived from the CoT message date.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if there is not a valid CoT time encountered.
